did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, College of William and Mary
did.unittitle:
Abner Johnson Leavenworth Papers,
1825-1850.
did.abstract: Papers of Rev. Abner J. Leavenworth.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Curator of Manuscripts, Swem Library, College of William and Mary and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Abner Johnson Leavenworth Papers, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and papers of Rev. Abner J. Leavenworth, Presbyterian clergyman relating to his theological studies at Andover, Massachusetts and New Haven, Connecticut and his ministry at Waterbury and Bristol, Connecticut, Charlotte, North Carolina and Warrenton and Petersburg, Virginia. Includes correspondence and accounts, 1835-1838, with Turner & Hughes, booksellers in Raleigh, North Carolina. Includes correspondence with his wife Elizabeth M. Peabody Leavenworth and a letter, 1832, from missionary friends in Turkey.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection has been broken down into three Series: Series 1 are the letters, Series 2 are the accounts and Series 3 are other papers.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Subject: Presbyterian Church-- United States--Missions-- History--19th century.
controlaccess.subject: Booksellers and bookselling--North Carolina--History--19th century.
Turkey--History--1829-1878.

c01.head: Series 1: Correspondence of Reverend A. J. Leavenworth.

did.unittitle: Correspondence of Reverend A. J. Leavenworth.

scopecontent.p: Almost all of letters are to or from A. J. Leavenworth.

scopecontent.p: Followed by a letter from an unknown person to A. G. M[?] asking for aid in securing a position with the South Side Rail Road.
